definition: should/ought to/probably/must be/to deserve/to owe/to be sb's turn to do sth/that/the above-mentioned

sentences.english: Those students deserved it they started too big of disturbence.
sentences.chinese: 那些学生自招麻烦，活该。

sentences.english: Economists who ignore the recent rise in unemployment deserve to lose their jobs.
sentences.chinese: 忽视最近失业增加经济学家们，活该丢掉饭碗。

sentences.english: You start to doubt yourself and think you  deserve it.
sentences.chinese: 你开始怀疑自己，甚至觉得自己活该。

sentences.english: If it's Zouave, I'm damned if I'll go in the troop.
sentences.chinese: 要是采用法国步兵服呢，那我再去参军就活该了。

sentences.english: That's what I get, going to a jock party alone.
sentences.chinese: 我这是活该，竟然独自去参加这种士兵聚会。

sentences.english: Mike and his brother deserve it.
You can rest easy in the knowledge that you have done all you could.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎么说你已经吃了，要是得了病也活该。

sentences.english: One of my friends is being two-timed by her boyfriend, but I think she's had it coming.
sentences.chinese: 我一个朋友最近被她男友劈腿了，但我觉得她活该。

definition: to reap what one has sown (idiom)/to stew in one's own juice
to suffer as a consequence of one's own actions/you asked for it/to bring it on oneself (sth unpleasant)
to have only oneself to blame (idiom)/to bring trouble through one's own actions
to have bad luck/to be out of luck
disaster one brings on oneself/to be reponsible for something bad that happens to oneself/to have only oneself to blame
to have no sense of shame/shameless
guilty and deserves to be punished (idiom); entirely appropriate chastisement/the punishment fits the crime
